accuracy.description: The correctness of the final answer provided by the agent.

completeness.description: The extent to which the agent's solution covers all the steps required to solve the task.

efficiency.description: The amount of resources (e.g., time, computational steps) used by the agent to arrive at a solution.

robustness.description: The agent's ability to handle different types of inputs and unexpected scenarios without failure.

traceability.description: The ability to follow the reasoning path of the agent to understand how the solution was derived.

novelty.description: The innovation and uniqueness of the solution approach taken by the agent.

adherence_to_rules.description: The extent to which the agent's solution follows the defined rules and constraints of the task.

generalizability.description: The applicability of the agent's solution approach to a wide range of similar tasks.

scalability.description: The agent's capacity to maintain performance when scaled to larger or more complex versions of the task.

interpretability.description: The ease with which humans can understand and interpret the agent's actions and solutions.
